en: J. C. Craig writes to Professor Louis L. McInnis at College Station, Texas requesting a testimonial letter to help secure a teaching position or assistant role at a high school or academy for the fall term. Craig seeks a situation that would allow him to continue his studies while becoming self-sustaining, and mentions having spent time on his father's farm to improve his health. The letter reflects the employment practices and educational networks of late 19th-century Texas.
